org.swerverobotics.library.interfaces

Interface IBNO055IMU

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdaFruitBNO055IMU

    public interface IBNO055IMU
    Interface API to the Adafruit 9-DOF Absolute Orientation IMU Fusion Breakout - BNO055 sensor. You can create an implementation of this interface for a given sensor using ClassFactory.createAdaFruitBNO055IMU().
    See Also:
    IAccelerationIntegrator, ClassFactory.createAdaFruitBNO055IMU(OpMode, I2cDevice), http://www.adafruit.com/products/2472, http://www.bosch-sensortec.com/en/homepage/products_3/9_axis_sensors_5/ecompass_2/bno055_3/bno055_4

      static class  IBNO055IMU.GYRORANGE

      static class  IBNO055IMU.MAGOPMODE 
      static class  IBNO055IMU.MAGPOWERMODE 
      static class  IBNO055IMU.MAGRATE 
      static class  IBNO055IMU.Parameters
      Instances of Parameters contain data indicating how a BNO055 absolute orientation sensor is to be initialized.
      static class  IBNO055IMU.PITCHMODE 
      static class  IBNO055IMU.REGISTER
      REGISTER provides symbolic names for each of the BNO055 device registers
      static class  IBNO055IMU.SENSOR_MODE
      Sensor modes are described in Table 3-5 (p21) of the BNO055 specification, where they are termed "operation modes".
      static class  IBNO055IMU.TEMPUNIT 

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int cbCalibrationData
      The size of the calibration data, starting at ACCEL_OFFSET_X_LSB, is 22 bytes.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Shut down the sensor.
      Acceleration getAcceleration()
      Returns the last observed acceleration of the sensor.
      EulerAngles getAngularOrientation()
      Returns the absolute orientation of the sensor as a set of Euler angles.
      AngularVelocity getAngularVelocity()
      Returns the rate of change of the absolute orientation of the sensor.
      Acceleration getGravity()
      Returns the direction of the force of gravity relative to the sensor.
      Acceleration getLinearAcceleration()
      Returns the acceleration experienced by the sensor due to the movement of the sensor.
      MagneticFlux getMagneticFieldStrength()
      Returns the magnetic field strength experienced by the sensor.
      Acceleration getOverallAcceleration()
      Returns the overall acceleration experienced by the sensor.
      Position getPosition()
      Returns the current position of the sensor as calculated by doubly integrating the observed sensor accelerations.
      Quaternion getQuaternionOrientation()
      Returns the absolute orientation of the sensor as a quaternion.
      byte getSystemError()
      If getSystemStatus() is 'system error' (1), returns particulars regarding that error.
      byte getSystemStatus()
      Returns the current status of the system.
      double getTemperature()
      Returns the current temperature.
      Velocity getVelocity()
      Returns the current velocity of the sensor as calculated by integrating the observed sensor accelerations.

      Initialize the sensor using the indicated set of parameters.

      boolean isGyroCalibrated() 
      boolean isMagnetometerCalibrated() 
      boolean isSystemCalibrated()

      Low level: read data starting at the indicated register

      Low level: read the byte starting at the indicated register
      byte[] readCalibrationData()
      Read calibration data from the IMU which later can be restored with writeCalibrationData().

      Start (or re-start) a thread that continuously at intervals polls the current linear acceleration of the sensor and integrates it to provide velocity and position information.

      As in startAccelerationIntegration(Position, Velocity), but provides control over the frequency which which the acceleration is polled.

      Stop the integration thread if it is currently running.

    • Field Detail

      • cbCalibrationData

        static final int cbCalibrationData
        The size of the calibration data, starting at ACCEL_OFFSET_X_LSB, is 22 bytes.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(IBNO055IMU.Parameters parameters)
        Initialize the sensor using the indicated set of parameters. Note that the execution of this method can take a fairly long while, possibly several tens of milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        parameters - the parameters with which to initialize the IMU

      • close

        void close()
        Shut down the sensor. This doesn't do anything in the hardware device itself, but rather shuts down any resources (threads, etc) that we use to communicate with it.

      • getTemperature

        double getTemperature()
        Returns the current temperature. Units are as configured during initialization.
        Returns:
        the current temperature

      • getMagneticFieldStrength

        MagneticFlux getMagneticFieldStrength()
        Returns the magnetic field strength experienced by the sensor. See Section 3.6.5.2 of the BNO055 specification.
        Returns:
        the magnetic field strength experienced by the sensor, in units of tesla
        See Also:
        https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tesla_(unit)

      • getOverallAcceleration

        Acceleration getOverallAcceleration()
        Returns the overall acceleration experienced by the sensor. This is composed of a component due to the movement of the sensor and a component due to the force of gravity.
        Returns:
        the overall acceleration vector experienced by the sensor

      • getLinearAcceleration

        Acceleration getLinearAcceleration()
        Returns the acceleration experienced by the sensor due to the movement of the sensor.
        Returns:
        the acceleration vector of the sensor due to its movement

      • getGravity

        Acceleration getGravity()
        Returns the direction of the force of gravity relative to the sensor.
        Returns:
        the acceleration vector of gravity relative to the sensor

      • getAngularVelocity

        AngularVelocity getAngularVelocity()
        Returns the rate of change of the absolute orientation of the sensor.
        Returns:
        the rate at which the orientation of the sensor is changing.
        See Also:
        getAngularOrientation()

      • getAngularOrientation

        EulerAngles getAngularOrientation()
        Returns the absolute orientation of the sensor as a set of Euler angles.
        Returns:
        the absolute orientation of the sensor
        See Also:
        getQuaternionOrientation()

      • getQuaternionOrientation

        Quaternion getQuaternionOrientation()
        Returns the absolute orientation of the sensor as a quaternion.
        Returns:
        the absolute orientation of the sensor
        See Also:
        getAngularOrientation()

      • getPosition

        Position getPosition()
        Returns the current position of the sensor as calculated by doubly integrating the observed sensor accelerations.
        Returns:
        the current position of the sensor.

      • getVelocity

        Velocity getVelocity()
        Returns the current velocity of the sensor as calculated by integrating the observed sensor accelerations.
        Returns:
        the current velocity of the sensor

      • getAcceleration

        Acceleration getAcceleration()
        Returns the last observed acceleration of the sensor. Note that this does not communicate with the sensor, but rather returns the most recent value reported to the acceleration integration algorithm.
        Returns:
        the last observed acceleration of the sensor

      • startAccelerationIntegration

        void startAccelerationIntegration(Position initalPosition,
                                Velocity initialVelocity)
        Start (or re-start) a thread that continuously at intervals polls the current linear acceleration of the sensor and integrates it to provide velocity and position information. A default polling interval of 100ms is used.
        Parameters:
        initalPosition - If non-null, the current sensor position is set to this value. If null, the current sensor position is unchanged.
        initialVelocity - If non-null, the current sensor velocity is set to this value. If null, the current sensor velocity is unchanged.
        See Also:
        startAccelerationIntegration(Position, Velocity), getLinearAcceleration()

      • startAccelerationIntegration

        void startAccelerationIntegration(Position initalPosition,
                                Velocity initialVelocity,
                                int msPollInterval)
        As in startAccelerationIntegration(Position, Velocity), but provides control over the frequency which which the acceleration is polled.
        Parameters:
        initalPosition - If non-null, the current sensor position is set to this value. If null, the current sensor position is unchanged.
        initialVelocity - If non-null, the current sensor velocity is set to this value. If null, the current sensor velocity is unchanged.
        msPollInterval - the interval to use, in milliseconds, between successive calls to getLinearAcceleration()
        See Also:
        startAccelerationIntegration(Position, Velocity, int)

      • stopAccelerationIntegration

        void stopAccelerationIntegration()
        Stop the integration thread if it is currently running.

      • getSystemStatus

        byte getSystemStatus()
        Returns the current status of the system.
        Returns:
        the current status of the system See section 4.3.58 of the BNO055 specification.
        See Also:
        ResultMeaning
        0idle
        1system error
        2initializing peripherals
        3system initialization
        4executing self-test
        5sensor fusion algorithm running
        6system running without fusion algorithms

      • getSystemError

        byte getSystemError()
        If getSystemStatus() is 'system error' (1), returns particulars regarding that error. See section 4.3.58 of the BNO055 specification.
        Returns:
        the current error status
        See Also:
        ResultMeaning
        0no error
        1peripheral initialization error
        2system initialization error
        3self test result failed
        4register map value out of range
        5register map address out of range
        6register map write error
        7BNO low power mode not available for selected operation mode
        8acceleromoeter power mode not available
        9fusion algorithm configuration error
        Asensor configuraton error

      • isSystemCalibrated

        boolean isSystemCalibrated()

      • isGyroCalibrated

        boolean isGyroCalibrated()

      • isAccelerometerCalibrated

        boolean isAccelerometerCalibrated()

      • isMagnetometerCalibrated

        boolean isMagnetometerCalibrated()

      • readCalibrationData

        byte[] readCalibrationData()
        Read calibration data from the IMU which later can be restored with writeCalibrationData(). This might be persistently stored, and reapplied at a later power-on. For greatest utility, full calibration should be achieved before reading the calibration data
        Returns:
        the calibration data
        See Also:
        writeCalibrationData(byte[])

      • writeCalibrationData

        void writeCalibrationData(byte[] data)
        Write calibration data previously retrieved.
        Parameters:
        data - the calibration data to write
        See Also:
        readCalibrationData()

      • read8

        byte read8(IBNO055IMU.REGISTER register)
        Low level: read the byte starting at the indicated register
        Parameters:
        register - the location from which to read the data
        Returns:
        the data that was read

      • read

        byte[] read(IBNO055IMU.REGISTER register,
          int cb)
        Low level: read data starting at the indicated register
        Parameters:
        register - the location from which to read the data
        cb - the number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        the data that was read

      • write8

        void write8(IBNO055IMU.REGISTER register,
          int bVal)
        Low level: write a byte to the indicated register
        Parameters:
        register - the location at which to write the data
        bVal - the data to write

      • write

        void write(IBNO055IMU.REGISTER register,
         byte[] data)
        Low level: write data starting at the indicated register
        Parameters:
        register - the location at which to write the data
        data - the data to write
